children.name: Project Quality
desc: The overall quality of the project. In the context of embedded software, this is often assimilated to Maturity.

children.name: Ecosystem
desc: The degree of maturity for the ecosystem evolving around the project: is it active, diversified, responsive?

children.name: Process
desc: The complexity of the data flow structure in the code functions.

children.name: Product
desc: The complexity of the object-oriented architecture and structure. Composed of MDIT (maximum depth of inheritance tree).

children.name: Activity
desc: How active is the project ecosystem? Are there a lot of actions and events happening?

children.name: Diversity
desc: How diverse is the project ecosystem? Are there enough different actors to ensure its sustainability?

children.name: Responsiveness
desc: How fast people get an answer when they have a problem working with the project?

children.name: Support
desc: What is the amount of knowledge answered when someone requires help?

children.name: Visibility
desc: Do people talk about the software? Are there research articles, journal articles, and conference presentations?

children.name: Usage
desc: The degree of usage of the project: is it widely used, by different people in different context?

children.name: User feedback
desc: How do the users of the software evaluate the project and product?

children.name: Configuration Management
desc: Do the project applies best practices regarding software configuration management?

children.name: Change Management
desc: Do the project applies best practices regarding change management?

children.name: Intellectual Property Management
desc: How is intellectual property handled in the project? Is there an IP log? Are the project and the Eclipse Foundation safe regarding IP?

children.name: Planning Management
desc: Is the project behaviour predicable? Are outputs delivered on planned time and quality?

children.name: Test Management
desc: Is the product thoroughly tested? How many tests are there, what is the code coverage?

children.name: Analysability
desc: Degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which it is possible to assess the impact on a product or system of an intended change to one or more of its parts, or to diagnose a product for deficiencies or causes of failures, or to identify parts to be modified. (ISO/IEC 25010)

children.name: Changeability
desc: Degree to which a product or system can be effectively and efficiently modified without introducing defects or degrading existing product quality. (ISO/IEC 25010)

children.name: Reliability
desc: Degree to which a system, product or component performs specified functions under specified conditions for a specified period of time. (ISO/IEC 25010)

children.name: Reusability
desc: Degree to which an asset can be used in more than one system, or in building other assets. (ISO/IEC 25010)
